poem:
**Aerial Disturbance**

Silver-eyed intruders,  
whirring above the tarmac,  
disturb the quiet machinery  
of flight's sacred ritual.  
Bavarian skies, vexed,  
demanding ground's command—  
a call to arms against  
this hawkless invasion.  
Metal birds, ghostlike,  
hover at the brink,  
their wings whispering  
the chaos of an unseen storm.
